page.title: 17Sheltered Housing.
page.content: At West Hill, a block of unfurnished independent flatlets-four of them double ones-caters for elderly people who are well enough to look after themselves. There is a communal lounge, laundry facilities, coin box telephone and a guest room with sleeping accommodation to enable relatives and close friends to visit for short periods. The flatlets and some nearby bungalows are all linked to an alarm system which alerts the Warden in case of emergency. The Warden is employed by Carlisle City Council. She is on duty from 7pm to 12 noon the following day. A relief Warden takes over two days a week. The Warden visits each tenant once a day and will summon any service that may be needed in an emergency.
